intro: Pentacalia teretifolia, commonly known as the slender pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in various parts of the world for its delicate appearance.
